|Section2={{Chembox Properties
|  Formula = C<sub>192</sub>H<sub>250</sub>N<sub>57</sub>O<sub>107</sub>P<sub>19</sub>S<sub>19</sub>
|  MolarMass = 6266.094

|Section3={{Chembox Hazards

| FlashPt =

}}

'''Afovirsen''' is an [[oligonucleotide]] capable of [[antisense]] interactions with mRNA of [[human papillomavirus]]. It has been investigated as a tool for diagnostics and therapeutics.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Crooke|first1=RM|last2=Graham|first2=MJ|last3=Cooke|first3=ME|last4=Crooke|first4=ST|title=In vitro pharmacokinetics of phosphorothioate antisense oligonucleotides.|journal=The Journal of Pharmacology and Experimental Therapeutics|date=October 1995|volume=275|issue=1|pages=462–73|pmid=7562586}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|last1=Liang|first1=H|last2=Nishioka|first2=Y|last3=Reich|first3=C F|last4=Pisetsky|first4=D S|last5=Lipsky|first5=P E|title=Activation of human B cells by phosphorothioate oligodeoxynucleotides.|journal=Journal of Clinical Investigation|date=1 September 1996|volume=98|issue=5|pages=1119–1129|doi=10.1172/JCI118894}}</ref>

==Nucleic Acid Sequence==
Afovirsen consists of a sequence of 20 [[nucleic acids]]

ttgcttccat cttcctcgtc
